intro: Psychotria syringiflora, commonly known as the pink psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
